thread.section_title: Sports - Ridgecrest Daily Independent - Ridgecrest, CA
thread.title: Immanuel Christian Football: Crusaders end season with first league win
thread.title_full: Immanuel Christian Football: Crusaders end season with first league win

author: Christopher Livingston SPORTS EDITOR clivingston@ridgecrestca.com
title: Immanuel Christian Football: Crusaders end season with first league win
text: Posted Oct. 24, 2015 at 4:36 PM By Christopher Livingstonclivingston@ridgecrestca.com Posted Oct. 24, 2015 at 4:36 PM Ending the season on a high note, the Immanuel Christian Crusaders football team beat the Big Pine Warriors 54-22 for its first league win Saturday at Leroy Jackson Complex. The game was close in the opening half, as the Crusaders knocked off a potential Big Pine rally to go into the half leading by two touchdowns. In the second half, the Crusaders changed their offense. Thomas Castillo, in order to avoid aggravating a leg injury, replaced Bryce Benites at quarterback. Immanuel controlled the rest of the contest, as its defense shut out the Warriors. Jacob White slammed the door with two long rushing touchdowns. “Our running game was really strong today,” said ICS head coach Andy Castillo. “This whole week, we worked with a two-minute offense and had lots of conditioning." The Crusaders end the season 3-6 overall and 1-2 in Hi-Lo League play. By Christopher Livingston
